definition: major turning point of lifelong import (esp. marriage)
end/finish
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: I know I'm a in the neck. I just want you to be happy.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我很囉唆，可是這是妳的終身大事。

sentences.english: Finally, you've got to marry the person you love with your whole heart.
sentences.chinese: 終身大事，只能找個你全心全意愛的人。

sentences.english: Please accept my best wishes for a long and happy married life.
sentences.chinese: 請接受我對你們的終身大事所表示的最衷心的祝賀。

sentences.english: To the tide that marriage is marriage, to come in to think clearly.
sentences.chinese: 向潮認爲結婚是終身大事，要成雙考慮清楚。

sentences.english: Event of lifelong significance, usually refers to marriage.
sentences.chinese: 這可是他的終身大事，不可兒戲。

sentences.english: In addition, there are many couples who are rushing to get married during the holiday.
sentences.chinese: 另外尚有許多新人在長假期間趕著完成終身大事。

definition: lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
arranged betrothal of minors
old: to reap the consequences of one's words (idiom, from Mencius); modern: to go back on one's word/to blow hot and cold/to contradict oneself/inconsistent
to get straight to the point (idiom)
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
to have boundless prospects
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
stupid/stubborn/pigheaded
written repentance
masquerade
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
lit. to gnaw a book/to study/to cram
exceptionally intelligent (idiom)
